author: L.A. Waller and C.A. Gotway

organization.description: The National Institute for Applied Statistics Research Australia (NIASRA) is a research institute based at the University of Wollongong, Australia. It aims to identify Australia as a place where the discipline of applied statistics collaborates with academics and professionals in science, government, business and industry to tackle strategic problems. More information on NIASRA can be found at http://niasra.uow.edu.au/what-is-niasra/index.html
organization.title: NIASRA
organization.name: niasra

name: scottish-lip-cancer-data-set
notes:
Description
--------------

 This data set is provided in the package "gcmr" in R and published in Waller and Gotway (2004). It contains data on male lip cancer incidence in Scotland counties between 1975-1980.

Format
----------
The csv file contains 5 columns:

- observed: observed cases in each county.
- expected: excpected cases in each county.
- AFF: proportion of the population employed in agriculture, fishing, or forestry.
- latitude: county latitude.
- longitude: county longitude.

References
---------------

Clayton D. and Kaldor J. (1987). Empirical Bayes estimates of age-standardized relative risks for use in disease mapping. Biometrics 43, 671â€“681.

Waller, L.A. and Gotway, C.A. (2004) Applied Spatial Statistics for Public Health Data. New York: John Wiley and Sons.
title: Scottish lip cancer data set
